## The Declaration of Independence: A Simple Summary

The Declaration of Independence is a document that made the United States a free country. On July 4, 1776, leaders from 13 colonies agreed on it. They said they weren't going to follow British rules anymore and explained why.

Thomas Jefferson wrote the first draft. After some changes, everyone signed it. The document says all people have the right to life, liberty, and happiness. It inspired other countries to do the same. You can see the signed copy at the National Archives in Washington, D.C.
